title: Bowtie Analysis and Barrier Management
content: Bowtie diagrams map threats, top events, and consequences with barriers that prevent or mitigate. Human actions can be threats (initiating events) or escalation factors (barrier failures). Effective barrier management ensures barriers are in place, functional, and regularly tested. Human reliability is critical to barrier effectiveness.
openQuestions: Does your safety case use bowtie analysis to illustrate MAH control?
Where do human actions appear as critical barriers in your MAH scenarios?
